channel.title: SQLAlchemy 1.3.0 or greater is required
channel.description:
I use docker to install redash. When i run the command : /usr/local/bin/docker-compose run --rm server create_db,it throw errors ,the error message is : Creating redash_server_run ... done Traceback (most recent call last): File "/app/manage.py", line 6, in <module> from redash.cli import manager File "/app/redash/__init__.py", line 10, in <module> from flask_migrate import Migrate File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask_migrate/__init__.py", line 5, in <module> from alembic import __version__ as __alembic_version__ File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/__init__.py", line 3, in <module> from . import context # noqa File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/context.py", line 1, in <module> from .runtime.environment import EnvironmentContext File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/runtime/environment.py", line 1, in <module> from .migration import MigrationContext File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/runtime/migration.py", line 15, in <module> from .. import ddl File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/ddl/__init__.py", line 1, in <module> from . import mssql # noqa File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/ddl/mssql.py", line 8, in <module> from .base import AddColumn File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/ddl/base.py", line 11, in <module> from ..util.sqla_compat import _columns_for_constraint # noqa File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/util/__init__.py", line 32, in <module> raise CommandError("SQLAlchemy 1.3.0 or greater is required.") alembic.util.exc.CommandError: SQLAlchemy 1.3.0 or greater is required. ERROR: 1 redash_redis_1 is up-to-date redash_postgres_1 is up-to-date redash_email_1 is up-to-date Starting redash_server_1 ... done redash_scheduler_1 is up-to-date redash_worker_1 is up-to-date
but i have installed the SQLAlchemy ![image|690x173](upload://wrys6H0LlG4wMVlVUSkXoZ7quS4.png)
Could anyone help me?

item.title: SQLAlchemy 1.3.0 or greater is required
item.dc:creator: panda403
item.description:
My redash version is 8.0.0,is python2.7 suitable?

Read full topic

item.title: SQLAlchemy 1.3.0 or greater is required
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
What version of Redash are you installing? Your Python is on version 2.7 but the latest version of Redash uses Python 3.

Read full topic

item.title: SQLAlchemy 1.3.0 or greater is required
item.dc:creator: panda403
item.description:
I use docker to install redash.
When i run the command : /usr/local/bin/docker-compose run --rm server create_db,it throw errors ,the error message is :
Creating redash_server_run … done
Traceback (most recent call last):
File “/app/manage.py”, line 6, in
from redash.cli import manager
File “/app/redash/init.py”, line 10, in
from flask_migrate import Migrate
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask_migrate/init.py”, line 5, in
from alembic import version as alembic_version
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/init.py”, line 3, in
from . import context # noqa
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/context.py”, line 1, in
from .runtime.environment import EnvironmentContext
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/runtime/environment.py”, line 1, in
from .migration import MigrationContext
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/runtime/migration.py”, line 15, in
from … import ddl
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/ddl/init.py”, line 1, in
from . import mssql # noqa
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/ddl/mssql.py”, line 8, in
from .base import AddColumn
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/ddl/base.py”, line 11, in
from …util.sqla_compat import _columns_for_constraint # noqa
File “/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/alembic/util/init.py”, line 32, in
raise CommandError(“SQLAlchemy 1.3.0 or greater is required.”)
alembic.util.exc.CommandError: SQLAlchemy 1.3.0 or greater is required.
ERROR: 1
redash_redis_1 is up-to-date
redash_postgres_1 is up-to-date
redash_email_1 is up-to-date
Starting redash_server_1 … done
redash_scheduler_1 is up-to-date
redash_worker_1 is up-to-date

but i have installed the SQLAlchemy

Could anyone help me?

Read full topic
